sen.j: 泊瀬部皇女（はつせべのひめみこ、686年以前? - 741年（天平13年））は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Hatsusebe no himemiko (before 686? to 741) was a member of the imperial family who lived in the Asuka period.
Hatsusebe no himemiko (before 686? to 741) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Hatsusebe no himemiko (before 686? to 741) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 天武天皇の皇女で、母は宍人臣大麻呂の娘、かじ媛娘。
sen.e: Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Kajihime no iratsume, who was a daughter of SHISHIUDOOMI no Omaro.
Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Kajihime no iratsume, who was a daughter of SHISHIUDOOMI no Omaro.
Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Kajihime no iratsume, who was a daughter of SHISHIUDOOMI no Omaro.

sen.j: 同母兄弟は忍壁皇子・磯城皇子・同母の妹は託基皇女、夫は川島皇子。
sen.e: Her maternal half-brothers were Osakabe no miko (Prince Osakabe) and Shiki no miko (Prince Shiki), her younger maternal half-sister was Taki no himemiko (Princess Taki), and her husband was Kawashima no miko (Prince Kawashima).

Her brothers-uterine were Osakabe no miko (the Prince Osakabe) and Shiki no miko (the Prince Shiki), her younger maternal half-sister was Taki no himemiko (the Princess Taki), and her husband was Kawashima no miko (the Prince Kawashima).
sen.cmt: maternal half-brothers→brothers-uterine,maternal half-sister→sister-uterine と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Her brothers-uterine were Osakabe no miko (the Prince Osakabe) and Shiki no miko (the Prince Shiki), her younger maternal half-sister was Taki no himemiko (the Princess Taki), and her husband was Kawashima no miko (the Prince Kawashima).

sen.j: 大宝律令施行後は泊瀬部・長谷部内親王とも記述される。
sen.e: 泊瀬部皇女 is also written as 泊瀬部/長谷部内親王 after the enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
sen.cmt: 漢字そのものが取りざたされています。
sen.e: 泊瀬部皇女 is also written as 泊瀬部/長谷部内親王 after the enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
泊瀬部皇女 is also written as 泊瀬部/長谷部内親王 after the enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).

sen.j: 持統5年（691年）、川島皇子が死亡した時、万葉集巻2 194-195に柿本人麻呂が献じた歌がある。
sen.e: When Kawashima no miko died in 691, KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro dedicated waka poems, which are Nos. 194 and 195 in the book two of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
When Kawashima no miko died in 691, KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro devoted waka poems, which are Nos. 194 and 195 in the volume two of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
When Kawashima no miko died in 691, KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro devoted waka poems, which are Nos. 194 and 195 in the volume two of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).

sen.j: 夫の死後再婚しなかった。
sen.e: She never married after her husband died.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She never remarried after her husband died.
She never remarried after her husband died.

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）2月14日三品に昇進、4年後の天平13年（741年）3月28日に死亡した。
sen.e: She was promoted to the rank of Sanbon on March 23, 737, and died four years later on April 22, 741.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処天平9年（737年）2月14日：西暦737年3月23日となるようです。天平13年（741年）3月28日：西暦741年4月22日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: She was promoted to the rank of Sanbon on March 23, 737, and died four years later on April 22, 741.
She was promoted to the rank of Sanbon on March 23, 737, and died four years later on April 22, 741.
